title: Rate law for reaction between H2 and I2

content.description: <math alttext="H 2 gas plus I 2 gas produces 2 H I gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: For the reaction between <math alttext="H 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext=" I 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, shown above, the following two-step reaction mechanism is proposed.Step 1: <math alttext="I 2 is in equilibrium with 2 I " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>⇄</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></math> (fast equilibrium) Step 2: <math alttext="H 2 plus 2 I produces 2 H I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>I</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) What is the rate law expression for this reaction if the second step is rate determining?

choices.label: <math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of I 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of H 2 times the molar concentration of I 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of H 2 times the molar concentration of I 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
